B3216542339049F59AD6BE9BEF1E094D.description: reflects on, analyzes, and assesses strategies used while learning Nakaw?.

8EC3559FF25A48A69915E16BB78C1701.description: determines personal inquiry and learning goals; and,

B1F9A0F2BA5B42F2BA5C2ED9AC760827.description: reflects on new knowledge of Nakaw? and its value to self and the wider community;

CA754C85D4FA4FF591CFC74D54F70E8F.description: determines personal inquiry and researchs strengths and language goals;

91D3B92EE7744791AB99C5F277F3D7D8.description: reviews, refines, through reflection, feedback and selfassessment;

ED2D6D1E662142CA9CF58806EF541E4D.description: assesses own and others' work for clarity, correctness, and impact;

F4A30EECB5614B71BDBC751B2EE7BDA5.description: assess personal strengths and needs within the development of their own language learning as they relate to self, family and community and set goals for future improvement.

E7BAF5D1D8AC4E3894CB0B9CD2537960.description: develops and uses criteria for evaluating self, goals, and projects.

D1321AD13A404D6690F300F45A43BA88.description: evaluates the quality of own contributions to group process and sets goals and plans for further development; and,

363C3265F9874C28B15F018D89A79107.description: recognizes speaking, listening and viewing as useful tools to clarify thinking, communicating and learning;

D06E99EFF25F49DBB1B2EF8122FE8845.description: reflects on and identifies through the Nakaw? world-view and language;

7773E52D327843F2B40E736959643C4D.description: reflects on who they might approach to learn more about the Nakaw? language.

8E70C3CB5BD44C599CDF505EE4608A59.description: identifies with guidance what proficient Nakaw? speakers do;

9F0CA8C3F6204CD3B68702C03A157439.description: retells a traditional moral narrative orally with a focus on developing the main character; e.g., his/her strengths and weaknesses, his/her dilemma, the problem, the resolution, the lesson.

6E397506CC354192A9A633A561BF72AB.description: gives advice; e.g., write a letter of advice to themselves, to a younger brother, to a cousin living away; and,

2F2C4BD693D143DF9BBFD76FDBB00754.description: gives reasons and information to support a point of view on an issue, such as the position taken on learning languages, the position taken on political involvement;

F9DE6954ABE64DDCBB6404E9D0FAE321.description: Learners will perform language functions that Allow them to produce discourse.

5E25286103F145A2BE1DF42617B527FB.description: explores effective forms for recording and presenting or using research findings, such as incorporating technology, visual presentation, a magazine article, or written report.

177FBB574CCC44E9BA38A2CCADC7FE4B.description: follows protocol for acknowledging sources; and,

7B18F53AC11B4C2DB92FDB8C0C558F6C.description: prepares a report or presentation (written, visual, using technology);

8AB8B5972B61491688D5558288FB1F5A.description: organizes information in ways to fit the need or purpose of task;

E2CE89C4D8724D419422E7085E7E1FAB.description: practices and approaches cultural resource people with appropriate protocol for collecting information;

C9D74CEE5A4047D48979A8B0A039AED6.description: identifies possible sources of information, including people, written texts and media texts;

A69D60F151F545E3A122EC12F796F013.description: consults with community Elders, and identifies a research need or purpose to gather information on the Nakaw? culture;

A50B904B0D3B4D6C8BC52C57CB7EC96E.description: perform language functions that allow them to research.

BE4DCF8AB7C14F0FA5D62368868882DD.description: after hearing/viewing/reading discourse: demonstrates comprehension of main idea and details; demonstrates recognition of language techniques used for effectiveness of presentation identifies examples of implied or indirect language; and examines purpose, such as hedging and avoidance identifies the form of discourse chosen to match the purpose and audience, such as interview, music identifies the dilemma or conflicts and resolution faced by the main character in moral stories reflects on personal lessons learned from moral stories; and, identifies examples of puns and jokes; and examine their construct and purpose, such as gentle criticism, audience involvement;

C085898A4F9B48F88F5D6AB2F4167A21.description: engages in previewing or hearing activities that orient students to the discourse, such as providing background knowledge, recalling what is already known;

E7A64621A6594741B2417FF64FAC7E10.description: perform language functions that allow them to interpret discourse

A85C6957D4A340A1949E38768DCABDFC.description: demonstrates and explains an understanding of special symbols and objects used during celebrations and ceremonies, including their meaning and foundation in traditional narratives.

697447CECD7543FBAD9547562743816A.description: uses appropriate register at community events, such as introducing a speaker;

3F8056D560944BA68A46296D2CF5F939.description: carries on a simple conversation with another speaker, and uses appropriate register;

36A5AAF6B9E94809BDFA8B682DD8D7EA.description: appreciates the spontaneous humour in social situations;

62E32C25EF43422EB416734F816ED3F0.description: perform language functions that allow them to socialize and celebrate

409894A7AC97434297A6EFA169601E11.description: asks and answers questions using complete sentences.

80221AC6E9164456B0F246E980EEDD70.description: exchanges ideas and thoughts on topics of personal interest; and,

92D27669BD3742D9BCF7A161F960CA1A.description: seeks, in discussions and group work, the input of those who are experienced in the area of discussion;

5AE26D6CA670494AB1791AC9DF3AE33A.description: attempts to reformulate the ideas of others in discussions and group work to enable consensus;

BC5C7043CB974CA2A0DFCAF93BEE9D0D.description: listens actively to others, in discussions and group work, and solicits and offers ideas;

06DF07F9472544EC84A418CF8CF33726.description: exchanges information and opinions about moral dilemmas and issues affecting them personally;

7C7C8067456F4536859E99F720FC277C.description: perform language functions that allow them to get and give information.

52B2601402054D1FA4F54904EA652676.description: uses a wide range of interaction patterns to deal with routine and non-routine transactions and interactions.

65D49620BD13404090B8A866F15F5DEA.description: uses the appropriate level of formality with people in a variety of contexts; and,

447F776E60484E518313424083031E5B.description: adjusts language to suit audience and purpose;

373D4440235C4BF79163496FEC003B90.description: uses sentences and questions that contain learned vocabulary and familiar language structures in different forms;

0A03524482B7414B9EE395AAF769FC7D.description: uses linking devices throughout the discourse, though not with complete agreement;

E15D00FFF5C84E5E89B88FCB19468752.description: uses complex and compound sentences to hold ideas in discourse together;

9FF97894EED54FFBAFA84BB537FBA101.description: communicate meaningfully with coherency (coherency relates to the connectedness of information, thoughts and ideas within communication)

6BA1656E036E4EA58D4F823558055154.description: listens to and reiterates what another speaker has said, though the listener may need passage repeated or explained.

8AF83AB0AF984CB3A0FAF708A9482F3A.description: communicates thoughts, ideas, and feelings for specific purposes and audiences through a variety of verbal and visual media; and,

5B041362A12749D4A00B20BC6943734E.description: produces a variety of lengthy texts on topics, providing details to support the main point;

8DF9104895674AF4A859E21408B1F110.description: produces several sentences of spoken, coherent discourse, with relative detail and precision, in spontaneous situations;

E03761E9879A42A29D9263241DA1FD62.description: communicate meaningfully with proficiency (proficiency involves the ease with which communication is expressed or received).

CC7BC58736B042D2A11B4F1FE127F7D3.description: sustains conversations for up to 15 minutes.

63AC947CE45A4435BA8A93197F6B9702.description: reads factual texts or concrete information from a cultural study or prose that is relatively straightforward; and,

BD8B2D8E6DF34091AA1F3511423FACAC.description: uses understanding of the varying sound systems of different dialects to understand them better;

336CF3C90E3E4075B35E42E306CAC92E.description: uses idioms, and basic and specialized vocabulary from course content, to communicate ideas;

8A3467191FB341C5B3A7C86C48AAEE30.description: uses complex sentences and phrases but not without error;

0A9A03DCE7E24895A1248C3E1AD60B22.description: creates a variety of basic sentences using accurate grammar;

6B5FEE267A9046AC94589FF32972DF7B.description: communicate meaningfully with accuracy (accuracy is primarily the grammatical system of a language).

BF4355CFFF214C4DA5E24729256860D9.description: seeks help from Elders in Nakaw? language and cultural learning.

8F67E106C2C046619A2135308D89405A.description: uses a buddy system in learning Nakaw?; and,

967CE1ED411E4E899A5A3A489E6BA611.description: provides personal motivation for learning by rewarding self when successful;

EC5DECC64CB94242BE0F34F7A36A1D1B.description: monitors own anxiety about learning tasks, and takes measures to lower it if necessary;

1EBF7D3A4B7E4F93B6DC2B622BEE4E8A.description: asks follow-up questions to check for understanding;

7E2B49D6822A4155AB451650C8E6C5FA.description: uses various strategies to resume and sustain conversation;

A3A1CDF26CA5430786698B9E834FCAF7.description: uses social interaction skills to enhance group learning tasks;

51F2AC5345084F249336D3F17072CE2F.description: works with others to solve problems;

66EA5D745E8642F7B296B816E91130E7.description: works with others to solve problems;

4FF68673FBA74B30A9664571E0B75328.description: takes responsibility for planning, monitoring, and assessing own learning experiences;

0071C86E13234F2EB545045C3447D92D.description: reflects upon own thinking and learning processes;

E4E273184AA848F5BD85AE8A46000B6A.description: demonstrates awareness of own strengths and areas of improvement in Nakaw?;

331A925F3476438096F5477F91949462.description: identifies own language learning needs and goals and organize strategies and procedures accordingly;

E51209A50FED4F28B84A6D41B33B3A9E.description: uses previously acquired knowledge or skills to assist with a new learning task;

08FDCC97AB564D88A5EB193AC77F7136.description: seeks information through a network of sources including libraries, the World Wide Web, individuals, and agencies;

1E2E11BCB20E4C8696568B4C7F598432.description: uses reference materials or a speaker to verify or help in difficult areas of language;

6F7BB7DCDF9B4AE4A30C6C2D07F16268.description: seeks authentic language documents for research purposes;

3E6A61AD599042FE863687B5926331B0.description: selects the best form in which to express intent in a given context;

4C5F88F7ACF74BB4A4685E2E9479811F.description: infers meaning, and then verifies by reading or asking questions when opportunities arise;

A92CBF1681164C5CBA70156523BDF7F2.description: uses context clues to infer probable meanings of unfamiliar words;

D05C3E097A0A40A292ACF7C8801382E9.description: seeks opportunities outside class to practice and observe Nakaw?;

7B3DBD035FE44010A4D11B1485A5739C.description: seeks information through a network of sources (e.g., libraries, internet, others, agencies);

C8CE901523014523954BACC44EDD5B79.description: records unknown words and expressions, noting their context and function;

061B38CA77624CEFA49D26F080AF627F.description: learners will select and use appropriate strategies to maximize learning and communication.

9DEC24F28934445FAAB1EABE1C1B0950.description: writes a narrative or other creative text; and accompanies it with a visual, kinesthetic or oral presentation that adds to its effectiveness for a particular audience.

07F51F27E21B4A4AA570C755F786754B.description: writes a factual report based on researched information; and accompanies the written report with a visual presentation that adds to its effectiveness for a particular audience, such as graphics, display, computer interactive program, video program; and,

6E4E2477C9C04FB4A2872CEFFF504F1A.description: researches and reports historical information relating to current issues, such as residential schooling as it relates to present problems;

1D2E6669B3544D399B65DD17CB814397.description: shares personal reflections created such as a speech or a written text, in response to personal experiences or areas of cultural study;

A5399C79012045F384481D197A46C1B9.description: retells oral narratives or shares own writing orally and in written form, with the aid of various mediums, such as dramatization, art, or displays;

E118B33FB0CE4DA98D557FC4159082EC.description: Learners will produce language that is understandable to others.

A364F69E319441BD90855D349C400796.description: translates text between a Nakaw? language and another language.

AC85A5C70FBA406299CA04C033369A36.description: reads and interprets informational text that may be unfamiliar but relevant to research needs of the student; and,

FA4E4127326E43B7A7C1952A2DC4BB7B.description: reads and interprets text that has been transcribed from the oral tradition of Nakaw? people on a topic that is familiar to the student (contemporary lifestyles, fishing, hunting);

CF94254040354556A17EDACD609ADAB1.description: interprets contemporary reflections in various mediums that relate to cultural areas of study, such as documentaries on social problems in the community, theatre, magazine articles;

BC1B8A25820F4E0E8BDBB04307097921.description: interprets and produces speeches with a variety of purposes, such as inspirational, political, tributes and guidance, with the help of Elders or other adults in the community;

5265AD6D4F90423D8667570D396E85C6.description: interprets and explains or invites a speaker to share traditional narratives of the people: histories, moral stories, songs, informational texts, inspirational speeches;

7B0AD84A647F4BC699F9FE339E96A42F.description: interprets and explains the proceedings of meetings regarding topics relevant to cultural areas of study, such as land claims, or chief and council meetings;

10F812E3FF3D41C88457A6ADBA241F15.description: understand and interpret language as a connected set of ideas expressed in sentences.

3756B99B02A84530AA79DC45A2270289.description: interacts with a mentor on a project relating to the language and/or Nakaw? world-view.

99C563E6C54C4463BB6D617A056CF167.description: interacts with members of the community in acts of service to the community, such as volunteering at Elder's homes or with long term care; and,

C638B61F53924D47B8B4D779B625E37E.description: interacts with members of the community while participating in community events, such as wakes, Elders gatherings, meetings, and language festivals;

25C2BD77852B454F907CC044905D528B.description: interacts with members of the community and Elders while participating in nature camps;

EE9B124D8B1C4CD5807969C0286EBEE7.description: interacts with Elders or other adult members of the community to receive guidance or information about the history of the community in order to create a display of the information collected;

C166B53945594855B9BA0A6B620A6CEB.description: interacts with Elders or cultural resource people while researching or inquiring about cultural information;

862D82F8EAEC4F5FAC14E64E25E74013.description: interacts with classmates or school personnel in decision-making meetings, such as student council, class meeting, group project;

6088430F4FE44BD88D8839EDE4C53E00.description: discusses and promotes positive interactions and relationships in the school;

53999C0E695049D0BAF661DB226D3F6E.description: interacts with classmates, school staff and visitors;

46C509FCED3941E3970880D72075B463.description: participates actively in developing language and cultural skills during experiential learning opportunities, such as helping at community/cultural events, volunteering with day-care children, visiting and conversing with Elders in the community, planning cultural camps/activities;

CB34FD856C9A4B4F82CA763358B56913.description: seeks information to further understanding of Nakaw? concepts from Elders and other knowledge keepers within the community;

E6B46E02CA1C44CE9E83810FD91012AF.description: interacts with classmates in pairs or small groups to complete class projects in the Nakaw? language;

8BF0CE7137B6465A881FF33DC2FB2426.description: interacts with classmates and teacher during language learning activities;

A0EE695D10EE4A7F9543BAEF6F797388.description: view, interact, and experience the natural and constructed environments of their community.
